person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A " Euro-sceptic " member of the ruling Conservative party said on Thursday British finance minister Kenneth Clarke had to resign to prevent the party disintegrating over the issue of a single European currency .

Let's think step by step.

1. A Euro-sceptic: This is a label or role given to a person who holds critical views towards the European Union and the idea of a single European currency.
2. British finance minister: Kenneth Clarke is the identified person holding this position.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Person.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

location.content:
Please identify the "Location" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A " Euro-sceptic " member of the ruling Conservative party said on Thursday British finance minister Kenneth Clarke had to resign to prevent the party disintegrating over the issue of a single European currency .

Let's think step by step.

1. Euro-sceptic member: This refers to a person who holds critical views towards the European Union and its policies, particularly the idea of a single European currency. It is not a specific location.
2. Ruling Conservative party: This is a political party in the United Kingdom. It is not a specific location.
3. British finance minister: Kenneth Clarke is a person who holds a political position in the United Kingdom government. He is currently the finance minister, but the term "British finance minister" does not refer to a specific location.
4. Issue of a single European currency: This refers to the European Monetary Union and the Euro as the single currency used by some European countries. It is not a specific location.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Location.
There are no clear location entities in the paragraph. All entities mentioned refer to political figures, parties, or issues.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Location".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Location |
| --- |
| N/A |

The paragraph does not contain any clear location entities. All entities mentioned refer to political figures, parties, or issues.

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A " Euro-sceptic " member of the ruling Conservative party said on Thursday British finance minister Kenneth Clarke had to resign to prevent the party disintegrating over the issue of a single European currency .

Let's think step by step.

1. Euro-sceptic: This is a label or description for a person, not an organization. It refers to someone who is skeptical or critical of the European Union and its policies, particularly those related to economic and monetary union.
2. Ruling Conservative party: This is an organization. It is the political party currently in power in the United Kingdom.
3. British finance minister: This is a position or office within the government of the United Kingdom. Kenneth Clarke held this position at the time the paragraph was written.
4. Party: This is a general term for a political organization. In this context, it refers to the Conservative party.
5. Issue of a single European currency: This is a topic or matter of debate, not an organization. It refers to the European Monetary Union and the Euro as the single currency used by some European countries.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Organization.
1. Ruling Conservative party: This is an organization. It is the political party currently in power in the United Kingdom.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
